movies.title: Keizoku: The Movie
movies.plot: A police chief retiring, said police chief falling in love with a schoolgirl, a younger police chief moving into the position and taking on unsolved cases dating back years, etc. may be routine, not unusual and the order of things, but there is something else a afoot. There may or may not be phantom figures, portals to another world and distorted history at play. Keizoku: The Movie follows Keizoku the television serial.
movies.simplePlot: A police chief retiring, said police chief falling in love with a schoolgirl, a younger police chief moving into the position and taking on unsolved cases dating back years, etc. may be ...

biography.bio: Miki Nakatani was born on January 12, 1976 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Ringu (1998), Memories of Matsuko (2006) and Ringu 2 (1999).
biography.name: Miki Nakatani

biography.bio: Atsuro Watabe was born on May 5, 1968 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor and director, known for Sacrifices of War (2011), Love Exposure (2008) and Inugami, l'esprit du mal (2001). He was previously married to Rikako Murakami.
biography.name: Atsuro Watabe

biography.bio: One of Japan's most distinctive character actors, Eisei Amamoto is one of their cinema's few personalities who is easily recognizable to Western movie buffs. Tall (six feet) and skeletal of build, bony-faced and wild-haired (when not ensconced in a vast silver wig), Amamoto's persona inspired Woody Allen to dub him with an imitation Peter Lorre voice in What's Up Tiger Lily? (1966). He was better served by Paul Frees' menacing tones in King Kong Escapes (Kingukongu no gyakushu, 1967). But neither voice matches Amamoto's own, surprisingly deep and resonant for his scrawny, sunken-chested frame. It might have served him well had he pursued his original career choice: politics. He barely managed to dodge the draft into Japan's Pacific War, through acceptance to Tokyo University, his nation's most prestigious school. He studied law, for he wished to become a diplomat, but he soon grew disillusioned in his studies, his world view darkened by the mire into which his country was plunging through its disastrous war. A sympathetic older sister rescued him from his self-confessed nihilism by introducing him to friends in the entertainment field who encouraged Amamoto to become an actor. Through these connections, Amamoto landed a place in the highly regarded Hayuza group of stage actors, where in an early bit of what would become typecasting, he portrayed a knife-wielding madman in the play "Dojinkai". There he was spotted by director Keisuke Kinoshita, who observed "THERE'S an interesting-looking guy", and promptly cast him in a small but pivotal role in his classic Twenty-Four Eyes (1954). Amamoto later joined Toho Studios, where he was at first nothing more than a background player in the likes of Nippon Tanjo (1959). His parts grew steadily larger and more showy in the likes of Denso ningen (The Secret of the Telegian, 1960) and Yojinbo (1961). By the late 1960s he was equally recognized for samurai films like Sword of Doom and science fiction/fantasy projects like Kingukongu no gyakushu (1967). Though he could hardly be less similar to Peter Lorre, he is at least as big a cult figure in present-day Japan, lending his name and presence to any number of films, TV shows and animated productions. As well, he has cultivated a reputation as an eccentric TV talkshow presence. Always fascinated by the country of Spain, he has also played flamenco guitar on the stage, sometimes in collaboration with his friend and fellow actor Yoshio Tsuchiya. He has written several books about Spain, and spends as much time living there as he can.
biography.name: Hideyo Amamoto

biography.bio: Inuko Inuyama was born on December 16, 1965 in Tokyo, Japan as Chie Tozuka. She is an actress, known for Pokémon (1997), Pokémon the Series: Ruby and Sapphire (2002) and Pokémon the Series: Diamond and Pearl (2006).
biography.name: Inuko Inuyama

biography.bio: David Itô is an actor, known for Hokuto no Ken - L'ère de Julia (2007), Female Prisoner 1316 (2004) and Kiss me or kill me: Todokanakutemo aishiteru (2005).
biography.name: David Itô

biography.bio: Pinko Izumi was born on September 11, 1947 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Wataru seken wa oni bakari (1990), Gakko II (1996) and Keishichô Shinri Sôsakan Asuka 1 (2011).
biography.name: Pinko Izumi

biography.bio: Shigeru Izumiya was born on May 11, 1948 in Aomori, Japan. He is an actor and writer, known for Pom Poko (1994), Why Not? (1981) and Sanbiki no ossan (2014).
biography.name: Shigeru Izumiya

biography.bio: Hairi Katagiri was born on January 18, 1963. She is an actress, known for Silence (2016), Kamome Diner (2006) and R100 (2013).
biography.name: Hairi Katagiri

biography.bio: Kera was born on January 3, 1963 in Tokyo, Japan as Kazumi Kobayashi. He is a director and writer, known for Tsumi toka batsu toka (2009), Prescription Police (2006) and Gumi. Chocolate. Pine (2007).
biography.name: Kera

biography.bio: Gaining her first exposure to Western audiences in Edward Zwick's 2003 film The Last Samurai (2003), Koyuki was well-known in Japan for years before that. She first caught the attention of the public in 1997 by winning an exclusive modelling contract with the magazine Non-no, but quickly grew beyond modelling and has earned acclaim as an actress through her many roles on Japanese television and in several Japanese films.
biography.name: Koyuki

biography.bio: Rie Minemura was born as Rie Suzuki. She is an actress, known for Tokyo! (2008), After the Storm (2016) and Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack (2001).
biography.name: Rie Minemura

biography.bio: Katsuyuki Murai was born on December 17, 1969. He is an actor, known for Yomigaeri (2002), Kamen Rider 555: Paradise Lost (2003) and Quiz (2000).
biography.name: Katsuyuki Murai

biography.bio: Katsuhisa Namase was born on October 13, 1960 in Hyogo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Kamikaze Girls (2004), Shara (2003) and Gokusen: The Movie (2009).
biography.name: Katsuhisa Namase

biography.bio: Raita Ryû was born on January 21, 1940 in Minoo, Osaka, Japan as Tatsuo Hasegawa. He is an actor, known for Super Express 109 (1975), Station (1981) and Kanbakku (1990).
biography.name: Raita Ryû

biography.bio: Toshiya Sakai is an actor, known for Love Letter (1995), La marche de Kamata (1982) and Swallowtail Butterfly (1996).
biography.name: Toshiya Sakai
